languages.text: {n}Висирь осматривает храм зашитыми глазами.{/n} "Я вижу тех отголоски, кто был до нас и был с нами, но уже отправился на другую сторону. Моих братьев и сестер, культом взрощенных. Слышу их в их посмертии. Они — мудростью делятся. Я — им внимаю. Другие не слышат ткачи, ибо то — мое бремя".

{n}The Vizsier turns his head as if looking around the temple.{/n} "I see echoes of those who came before us and those who were with us, but have since crossed over to the other side. My brothers and sisters raised by the cult. I hear them from beyond their deaths. They share their wisdom. I heed them. The other spinners, they hear not, for that burden is mine to bear."
languages.original_text: {n}Висирь осматривает храм зашитыми глазами.{/n} "Я вижу тех отголоски, кто был до нас и был с нами, но уже отправился на другую сторону. Моих братьев и сестер, культом взрощенных. Слышу их в их посмертии. Они — мудростью делятся. Я — им внимаю. Другие не слышат ткачи, ибо то — мое бремя".

traits.locale_text: {n}The Vizsier looks around the temple with his sewn-shut eyes.{/n} "I see echoes of those that came before us and those that were with us, but have since crossed over to the other side. My brothers and sisters raised by the cult. I hear them in their afterlife. They share their wisdom. I heed them. The other Weavers cannot hear them, for that burden is mine to bear."

languages.text: {n}Der Wesir dreht den Kopf, als würde er sich im Tempel umsehen.{/n} "Ich sehe Echos derer, die vor uns gekommen sind. Und Echos derer, die bei uns waren, seitdem aber auf die andere Seite übergegangen sind. Meiner Brüder und Schwestern, die vom Kult aufgezogen wurden. Ich höre sie von jenseits des Todes. Sie teilen ihre Weisheit. Ich höre auf sie. Die anderen Spinner hören sie nicht, denn dies ist meine Last."
languages.original_text: {n}The Vizsier turns his head as if looking around the temple.{/n} "I see echoes of those who came before us and those who were with us, but have since crossed over to the other side. My brothers and sisters raised by the cult. I hear them from beyond their deaths. They share their wisdom. I heed them. The other spinners, they hear not, for that burden is mine to bear."

traits.locale_text: {n}Der Wesir dreht den Kopf, als würde er sich im Tempel umsehen.{/n} "Ich sehe Echos derer, die vor uns gekommen sind. Und Echos derer, die bei uns waren, seitdem aber auf die andere Seite übergegangen sind. Meiner Brüder und Schwestern, die vom Kult aufgezogen wurden. Ich höre sie von jenseits des Todes. Sie teilen ihre Weisheit. Ich höre auf sie. Die anderen Spinner hören sie nicht, denn dies ist meine Last."

languages.text: {n}El Visir gira la cabeza, como si echara un vistazo al templo.{/n} «Veo ecos de quienes nos precedieron y de quienes estaban con nosotros, pero han pasado ya al otro lado. Mis hermanos y hermanas del culto. Los oigo desde más allá de su muerte. Comparten su saber. Yo escucho. Los otros tejedores no los oyen, pues esa carga es solo mía».
languages.original_text: {n}The Vizsier turns his head as if looking around the temple.{/n} "I see echoes of those who came before us and those who were with us, but have since crossed over to the other side. My brothers and sisters raised by the cult. I hear them from beyond their deaths. They share their wisdom. I heed them. The other spinners, they hear not, for that burden is mine to bear."

traits.locale_text: {n}El Visir gira la cabeza, como si echara un vistazo al templo.{/n} «Veo ecos de quienes nos precedieron y de quienes estaban con nosotros, pero han pasado ya al otro lado. Mis hermanos y hermanas del culto. Los oigo desde más allá de su muerte. Comparten su saber. Yo escucho. Los otros tejedores no los oyen, pues esa carga es solo mía».

languages.text: {n}ヴィジールは神殿内を見回すかのように首をかしげる。{/n}「我々より先に来た者たち、そして我らとともにいたが、その後あちら側に渡ってしまった者たちの残響が見える。教団に育てられた私の兄弟姉妹たちが。死の先の彼らの声を聴く。彼らは知恵を分かち合う。私はそれに耳を傾ける。他の紡績工は、それを聞くことはない。その重荷は私が背負うべきものなのだから」
languages.original_text: {n}The Vizsier turns his head as if looking around the temple.{/n} "I see echoes of those who came before us and those who were with us, but have since crossed over to the other side. My brothers and sisters raised by the cult. I hear them from beyond their deaths. They share their wisdom. I heed them. The other spinners, they hear not, for that burden is mine to bear."

traits.locale_text: {n}ヴィジールは神殿内を見回すかのように首をかしげる。{/n}「我々より先に来た者たち、そして我らとともにいたが、その後あちら側に渡ってしまった者たちの残響が見える。教団に育てられた私の兄弟姉妹たちが。死の先の彼らの声を聴く。彼らは知恵を分かち合う。私はそれに耳を傾ける。他の織り手は、それを聞くことはない。その重荷は私が背負うべきものなのだから」

languages.text: {n}宿老转着头，似乎在环顾圣殿。{/n}“我能听到前人留下的回声，那些人如今已经去了彼岸。我的兄弟姐妹们都是在教派中长大成人的，即便是他们死去之后，我也能听到他们的声音。他们会分享智慧，而我聆听他们的智慧。其他的织网者听不到这些声音，因为这是属于我的重担。”
languages.original_text: {n}The Vizsier turns his head as if looking around the temple.{/n} "I see echoes of those who came before us and those who were with us, but have since crossed over to the other side. My brothers and sisters raised by the cult. I hear them from beyond their deaths. They share their wisdom. I heed them. The other spinners, they hear not, for that burden is mine to bear."

traits.locale_text: {n}宿老转着头，似乎在环顾圣殿。{/n}“我能听到前人留下的回声，那些人如今已经去了彼岸。我的兄弟姐妹们都是在教派中长大成人的，即便是他们死去之后，我也能听到他们的声音。他们会分享智慧，而我聆听他们的智慧。其他的织网者听不到这些声音，因为这是属于我的重担。”

languages.text: {n}Le vizir tourne la tête comme pour observer le temple autour de lui.{/n} « Je perçois les échos de nos prédécesseurs et de nos contemporains qui sont déjà passés de l'autre côté. Mes frères et sœurs en religion. Je les entends par-delà le voile de la mort. Ils prêchent la sagesse et je les écoute. Les autres tisseurs, eux, ne les entendent pas, car ce fardeau n'incombe qu'à moi. »
languages.original_text: {n}The Vizsier turns his head as if looking around the temple.{/n} "I see echoes of those who came before us and those who were with us, but have since crossed over to the other side. My brothers and sisters raised by the cult. I hear them from beyond their deaths. They share their wisdom. I heed them. The other spinners, they hear not, for that burden is mine to bear."

traits.locale_text: {n}Le vizir tourne la tête comme pour observer le temple autour de lui.{/n} « Je perçois les échos de nos prédécesseurs et de nos contemporains qui sont déjà passés de l'autre côté. Mes frères et sœurs en religion. Je les entends par-delà le voile de la mort. Ils prêchent la sagesse et je les écoute. Les autres tisseurs, eux, ne les entendent pas, car ce fardeau n'incombe qu'à moi. »

languages.text: {n}Vezir, tapınağa göz gezdirircesine kafasını çeviriyor.{/n} "Bizlerden önce gelenlerin ve bizlerle birlikte olanların ama o zamandan beri öteki tarafa yolculuklarını tamamlayanların, tarikatın yetiştirdiği kardeşlerimin yankılarını görüyorum. Ölümlerinin ötesinden bile onları duyuyorum. Bilgeliklerini paylaşıyorlar, ben de onlara kulak veriyorum. Diğer dokurlar onları duymaz. Çünkü bu yükü benim taşımam gerek."
languages.original_text: {n}The Vizsier turns his head as if looking around the temple.{/n} "I see echoes of those who came before us and those who were with us, but have since crossed over to the other side. My brothers and sisters raised by the cult. I hear them from beyond their deaths. They share their wisdom. I heed them. The other spinners, they hear not, for that burden is mine to bear."
